values:
*pulling cobwebs from my hair*

Ya, been a while since I've been in here. 

*waving at the dust floating in front of my face*

It’s art-lurker's fault. I saw that she’d been on my etsy shop (still not sure how that manages to link back to a viewer) and I had to come see who she is. She has the most amazing imagination!! 

 

So I figured I should post an update since it’s only been YEARS since I was last in here.  Like I have so many followers to keep in touch with. LOL

 

CM & I had our 10th anniversary this month. Gawd. I was sooo done with H #1 way before 10 years!   If #1 had left on a biz trip to China, I would have said “cool, seee ya!”. I cried when F left. C-R-I-E-D!!  Like a flippin’ baby. 

 

Claire just got her yellow belt in Tae Kwon Do!  We’re seriously impressed. She usually approaches things with a “fun” attitude. Like “I’ll do this for a while”. She’s already planning to change her summer schedule to make sure she gets her Level 2 Yellow before she goes up to San Jose for vacation. Level 2 Yellow is half way to Green. I don’t know if all TKD schools do this, but it’s really great and breaks the goals down into shorter terms, so she has 3 months till testing for the next level instead of six.

 

Josh is in Hawaii with is gf! I never wanted my kids to get into serious relationships when they were this young (18), but I think he and Jenn (21) are a really great match and I hope they are together a long time. Either way, they’re out seein’ the world and enjoying life when college and work schedules allow. WOO HOO!! 

 

OH!! Baby bunnies!!

 

http://www.youtube.com/user/CaliSunshinegirrl

 

 

I can’t wait till all the loose fur can be taken out of the cage! I need a shower every time I go out to check on them. YUCK And we can’t have ANY fur come back into the house because CM has horrid allergies.  And he wants to get a doe to breed regularly??!! I think he might change his mind after this first litter!! 

 

My stuff…

 

I have a blog that I keep up a bit more often than this one (think I’ll copy/paste most of this over there cuz I’m bein’ lazy and it needs an update).

 

http://calisunshinegirrl.blogspot.com/

 

And I have an etsy store for the hair sticks… PurpleMoonDesigns.etsy.com.  I just received a couple books I ordered on precious metal clay and and fusing metals. I’m really looking forward to getting into that!! I’m not sure how I’ll work it into hair sticks yet, other than making PMC beads, but I’ll come up with something. Till I do, I’ll just make earrings and bracelets and all that.

 

Ok, stuff to do! 

 

Thank you art lurker for stopping by!! :o)

My ex asked this morning if he can have our daughter baptized.  She was dedicated to each of our religions when she was a baby (he is protestant and i'm pagan/wiccan).  i'm not sure how i feel about his request.  No, i know exactly how i feel about his request but i need to explore it and come up with solid, unarguable reasons against it. 

The one person around right now that i tried to talk to says she thinks i should allow my daughter to "embrace the christian religion and let her make her own choice when she gets older", i almost puked at that comment and promptly stopped talking to her about it. But trying to have a serious conversation with her is a whole other story. i should have posted all the drama i had with her last fall here, it would have been fun to read it again. *L* (or did i and just don't remember?)

i think my reason for not wanting her to be baptized is because it will send her a message of "this is who you are". i don't have a problem with her learning the religion or even going to church on occasion, but i don't want her to BE christian. If she chooses that path when she is an adult and can make an informed, mature decision, i will be happy for her that she found something that fits her beliefs.  But since she is only just turning 10, the message will be that of a child trying to figure out where she fits in the world. It would influence how she thinks she should behave, the decisions she makes, even the words she uses. And i'm not over analyzing that. 

More than likely what is going to happen is that she will be baptized and i will have to talk to her more about my religion in order to counter-balance her theological influences.  The problem with that is i don't follow any particular set path.  i just do what is right for me and i don't feel i have anything other than that to pass on to her. Guess it's time to start exploring my beliefs again. Could it be that is the ultimate conflict i have? That this will cause me to study my own religion when i had finally come to terms with the way i 'practice' it? Ok, that just going to get too deep and we don't need to go there on too little sleep this week. LOL

i came in cuz i'm bored and not ready to go to bed and decided i'd see what leggylady might have written today, because she is such a faithful member and i knew she would have written something.  And my step-son, who is laying on the couch behind me says "is that LJ? you should add me".  So i get nosy and go into his LJ and leave a comment on one of his posts... then i come over to my own LJ and read some of my own posts... all i have to say is 

J, STOP READING NOW BECAUSE YOU DO NOT WANT TOO MUCH INFO!!

There, you have been warned and if you continue to read, well, they are your own nightmares. LMAO 

Honestly, i don't care much, but you seriously don't want to read any further. It has to do with parents don't have sex and stuff like that.

I HATE THE WAY PPL DRIVE IN SOUTHERN CAL!!! ARRRRGGGGHHHH!!!! 

*deep breath* that felt so good, even if it wasn't an RT scream.

In San Jose, if you don't drive at least 70 on the freeway (and some surface streets) you'll get run over.  Around here, if you even try to drive the speed limit (65), you're going to hit someone! It drives me absolutely batty! 

i wanna go home early today but a friend is having trouble with his girlfriends (yes, plural). *sigh* Why couldn't he have had this issue earlier in the day? *L* At least they are VT g/fs and i can just remind him that his loyalties are with his RT wife and he needs to just get over it. *L*  That would be mean. *giggling* i totally understand what he's going through, and what the g/fs are going through... but i wanna go hoooome! *whines*

Damn it LeggyLady, this is two posts in one day, what have you gotten me into???? *grins*

So now i sit waiting for my friend to get back on Yahoo so i can talk him through this and i have nothing to do for i don't know how long and i'm just waiting and waiting and waiting.... on the other hand, why are you still reading this?

Well damn, thats the last time i ask a coworker where they are off to.  How do you respond to "i'm going to bury my mom"?? 

i came in here to post nothing and got off track by posting something.

Bosses wife came in today and was so wonderful to let me know how much bossman raves about me *beaming* and here i thought all i did was manage to waste time and play most of my day away. LOL  Turns out they had moldy coffee and piles of mess before i came along. Now they can actually find things!

And bosses baby blessed us with the sweet sound of birth control. LOL  She's a cutie, but boy can babies be noisy when they want something. 

Gotta run an errand.

Bright blessings
Just checking how this works. Wonder how much i'll actually use it. But i had to sign up in order to post comments on Leggylady's entries! *L*
